avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.description:
Here on Dr. Zzs Discord we would like everyone to have a good experience.  We strongly encourage you to pick an avatar that reflects you and not continue to use the default Clyde icon. 
üî∏ First find a small picture that you like and that you want to represent you. 
üî∏ Click the gear next to your name near the bottom of the page. 
üî∏ Hover over the icon and click it. 
üî∏ Select your new picture file here. 
üî∏ Save it and pop back and it will appear!

backend.title: Unix Backend Infrastructure
backend.description:

Understanding this will help you be able to maintain your own system. 
[Software Engineering YouTube Channel](<https://www.youtube.com/user/GISIGeometry>)

backup.title: Home Assistant Backup
backup.description: Be sure to regularly, automatically, back up your Home Assistant install. There are various critical files and configuration options (like the Z-Wave network key), plus all your time. Hass.io has snapshots, and for unix type installs see <https://blog.ceard.tech/2017/10/backing-up-home-assistant.html>.  Oh, and most important of all **test your ability to restore regularly**.

code.title: Formatting code in Discord
code.description:
Paste your code in the following format Replacing `json` with your desired language:
 \`\`\``json` 
Code Here
\`\`\`
`Before:`
{"greeting":"Hello World"}

`After:` ```json
{"greeting":"Hello World"}```[More information](https://github.com/Blade2021/HIVE/wiki/Code-Formatting-&-Validation)

discord_fonts.title: Displaying Emoji's in Discord using Linux
discord_fonts.description:
If the icons next to names and reactions in Discord are showing as empty boxes or  mono color, try this.  
Install the font, in Debian this is the command:  

```sudo apt update;sudo apt install fonts-noto-color-emoji -y```

[Then follow the instructions on this page...](<https://victor.kropp.name/blog/emoji-on-linux/>)

getting_started.title: Getting Started with Home Assistant

You can find some worked examples at [HA Cookbook](https://home-assistant.io/cookbook/).

git_repo.title: Sending your HA Configuration to Github
git_repo.description:
Integrating your HA Configuration is a bit challenging, but having a way to trace back and remember what you did (when) is very useful.  
Here are a couple of people that have made the step by step easier for you.  

  üî∑ [Bearded Tinker Pushing the Repo and Travis Integration](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RAvdsVg0u3E)  
  üî∑ [Doc showing the way on a LiveStream!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pe40iHjulMM)  
  üî∑ [An HA Community article on the process](https://community.home-assistant.io/t/sharing-your-configuration-on-github/195144)  
  üî∑ [Bearded Tinkerer setting up the GitHub Repo Sensor Integration](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rzE9WXZj6N8)

group.title: HA Groups
group.description: Groups allow the user to combine multiple entities into one, and create views in the default dashboard. See <https://home-assistant.io/components/group/> for information.

ha_supervised.title: Setting up HA Supervised
ha_supervised.description:
Home Assistant Supervised can be installed on top of Docker on any generic linux system, a Debian based system is recommended. Below you will find links to tutorials and resources. 

üè† [Matheson's Install HA Supervised on Debian](https://mathesonsteplock.ca/install-home-assistant-supervised-on-debian/) 
üè† [JuanMTech's Home Assistant on Docker and Ubuntu](https://youtu.be/ekVfLXnoM7k) 
üè† [HA Supervised Installer](https://github.com/home-assistant/supervised-installer) 
üè† [Install Docker Engine](https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/) 

Home Assistant (Supervised) is the version of Home Assistant which runs the Home Assistant Supervisor. 

The supervisor is is a container that runs in Docker which allows the use of Add-ons and manages updating and other maintenance of your Home Assistant Install. 

With the help of the generic Linux install script you can install Home Assistant (Supervised) on any Linux System running Docker

input_boolean.title: Input Boolean
input_boolean.description: Input booleans allow an entity to be created to save a toggleable state.  You can find more about them here: [More information](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/input_boolean/)

input_number.title: Input Number
input_number.description:
The `input_number` component allows the user to define values that can be controlled via the frontend and can be used within conditions of automation. The frontend can display a slider, or a numeric input box. Changes to the slider or numeric input box generate state events. These state events can be utilized as `automation` triggers as well.
```yaml
# Example configuration.yaml entry
input_number:
  slider1:
    name: Slider
    initial: 30
    min: -20
    max: 35
    step: 1
  box1:
    name: Numeric Input Box
    initial: 30
    min: -20
    max: 35
    step: 1
    mode: box
```
[More information:](<https://home-assistant.io/components/input_number/>)

justask.title: Just Ask a Question
justask.description:
Need assistance with something?  Just ask your question, instead of asking for permission.  If anyone knows the answer, they will reply.  

https://dontasktoask.com/

led_calc_power.title: üí´ Calculate LED Power
led_calc_power.description:
What is Power Injection? At its lowest level power injection is nothing more than adding additional power to a string of lights at a point in which the voltage drop starts to affect the lights [more info here](http://spikerlights.com/pwrinjection.aspx) 
This is a great calculator to help with judging the size of wire , power supplies , distance ,votage drop and much more [RGB Pixel Power Calculator](http://spikerlights.com/calcpower.aspx) 
How much power do addressable LEDs use?, Digitally Addressable LED Sheet[info found here](https://quinled.info/2020/03/12/digital-led-power-usage/)

ü¶Ö [Falcon controller support page](https://www.pixelcontroller.com/store/index.php?id_cms_category=5&controller=cms) *you will run these from fpp or your computer through xSchedule* *new firmware might change this*. 

ü¶Ö F16V3- 16 port Pixel Controller- 1024 pixels per output pixel controller [link](https://www.pixelcontroller.com/store/index.php?id_product=48&controller=product) 

ü¶Ö F48 Differential Controller- Can drive up to 16384 pixels. 48 Differential Outputs no local ports-Can connect up to 12 Falcon Differential Receivers. [Link](https://www.pixelcontroller.com/store/index.php?id_product=52&controller=product) 

ü¶Ö Falcon PiCap for a pi3 or pi4 Can control two strings 800+ WS2811 pixels with fused and buffered outputs. Dedicated RS-485 DMX Output (Renard, DMX, LOR selectable). Input voltage 5, or 12V selectable. [Link](https://www.pixelcontroller.com/store/index.php?id_product=47&controller=product)

mariaDB.title: Help with your Home Assistant Database Issues
mariaDB.description:
Home Assistant comes with a built-in version of SQLite database.  If you suspect a database problem, the home-assistant_v2.DB file in your config folder can be deleted or renamed to disable it.  HA will rebuild it immediately.  I would wait 10 minutes after deleting (or renaming the file before you restart HA to give the file a chance to rebuild. 

üìñ [Official HA Docs on Recorder](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/recorder/) 
üìñ [MariaDB Supervised Addon](https://github.com/home-assistant/hassio-addons/tree/master/mariadb) 
üìñ [WhatAreWeFixing.Today's YT Video](https://whatarewefixing.today/240/) 
üìñ [Official HA Docs on Database](https://www.home-assistant.io/docs/backend/database/) 
üìñ [Reddit thread about non-default Databases](https://www.reddit.com/r/homeassistant/comments/9z0tof/) 
üìñ [BurnsHA's YT Video](https://youtu.be/4rsxnN8gkHk) 

The default database that is used to store all recorded data in Home Assistant is SQLite.  As you get into a few dozen devices and hundreds of sensor data points, SQLite causes the occasional database corruption. If your Database file is over 1GB, if you are getting Recorder failures in the log, if sensor data randomly stops displaying in your user interface, it is probably time to purge the database. If this continues to happen to you, it may be time to replace the database with something else.

  The easiest way to replace the database is to use the Official Add-on MariaDB.  This is a mysql based program that can handle larger amounts of data better than the default.  

If you are not running the supervised version of HA, there is a video for you in the links as well.  Also other database solutions will work with Home Assistant, see the link for the recorder integration for more details.

rf433.title: Help with RF433 / RF315 Devices
rf433.description:
There is a lot of information on this subject.  Check out the links section and the Community can lead your journey here. 

üì∂ [How RF433 Works](https://bit.ly/DrZzsHow433Works) 
üì∂ [Flashing the RFBridge](https://bit.ly/DrZzsFlashRFBridgeTasmota) 
üì∂ [DrZzs Video](https://youtu.be/OfSbIFIJPuc) 
üì∂ [Digiblur Video](https://youtu.be/w_CchtI-oK0) 
üì∂ [WhatAreWeFixing.Today Video](https://whatarewefixing.today/?p=134) 
üì∂ [Multiple sensor setup](https://bit.ly/DrZzsRFBridgeMultiSensorSetup) 

The 433 mhz RF (radio frequency) band and the 315 mhz RF band, depending on the country you live in, is designated for the same purpose. Low power RF transmitters are allowed to broadcast within these frequency ranges. These small transmitters are usually binary type sensors because only a small message is able to be transmitted during an event. Door/Window sensors, PIR sensors, push button transmitters, remote controls and the like are the typical devices using these frequencies. There needs to be a receiver nearby to pick up these signals and act on the message received.

Devices such as the [Itead RFBridge](http://drzzs.com/RF_Bridge) and the [Bond Bridge](https://bit.ly/DrZzsBondBridge) act as reciever hubs to collect data from these sensors and feed the data back to a program such as Home Assistant for further action.  With some devices like the [Itead Sonoff Slampher](https://bit.ly/DrZzsSlampher), the device can ‚Äòpair‚Äô with a matching RF transmitter bought separately and act on the information provided. Devices are not tied to a common standard (like Zwave) which 1, keeps the price very low, but 2, causes incompatibility between manufacturers.

secrets.title: How Do HA Secrets Work?
secrets.description: Rather than putting sensitive information (passwords, locations, etc) into your configuration, you can store them in secrets to make sharing easier. See <https://home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/secrets/> for more.

tips.title: BOT Wrangling 101 on DrZzs Discord
tips.description:
There is a whole reference library in here to help you sort out things.  All contributions are from people on the channel.  

Type `{prefix}reflist` in the chat and you see the list.  Then (tilde) {prefix}topic will bring up that topic.  Also you can type `{prefix}commands` and get a list of BOT commands you nave access to.  

We tend to go to `#bot-spam` channel to activate those things so as to not fill up the topic channels with info just for you.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting Your HA Configuration Problems
troubleshooting.description: If you're having problems with your updates to your configuration, check the troubleshooting steps in <https://home-assistant.io/docs/configuration/troubleshooting/>

tuya_convert.title: Tuya Convert
tuya_convert.description:
To see instructions on getting started with Tuya Convert & the links here. 

üçò [Tuya Convert Github](https://github.com/ct-Open-Source/tuya-convert) 
üçò [Digiblur's Tuya Convert Flash Tuya Devices YT Video](https://youtu.be/dt5-iZc4_qU) 
üçò [Tasmota Templates](https://templates.blakadder.com/) 

Tuya convert is an exploit that attacks certain versions of Tuya firmware in order to replace the firmware with something we want.  The current release of the Tuya firmware has an encryption that prevents the exploit, so it works on fewer and fewer products currently being sold.  If someone can figure out the password....   Or someone at the factory would leak it, this may work again.  At this point only new-old-stock items that have not been used in the Tuya App might work.  Sadly most items will not and None that have been used in the Tuya App will convert.

THEREFORE......

Don't be shocked when the Tuya Convert doesn't work for you.  The man-in-the-middle attack that Tuys Convert was against Tuya Firmware has been patched by Tuya, and will likely not help you. 

Find a way to use the device as is, or find way to take the device apart and flash with a serial adapter.

twitchSub.title: Twitch Subscription
twitchSub.description:

Find out more about [Twitch Prime Here](https://www.twitch.tv/subs/drzzs)  
[Visit DrZzz's Twitch Channel](https://www.twitch.tv/drzzs)  

**Please remember to link your discord account to twitch to receive this role.**  
[->Twitch Integration Help link<-](https://support.discordapp.com/hc/en-us/articles/212112068-Twitch-Integration-FAQ) Scroll down to the `For Viewers` section.  

Note: The Twitch subscriber roles are updated every hour automatically, so be patient...
